alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 27 at 4:53PM AKST until March 01 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY FOR PORTAGE VALLEY AND EASTERN TURNAGAIN ARM... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. East winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Reduced visibility as low as one quarter mile. * WHERE...Portage Valley and eastern Turnagain Arm. * WHEN...From noon Tuesday to 6 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will increase Tuesday afternoon through Portage Valley and eastern Turnagain Arm, peaking Tuesday night and persisting into early Wednesday morning. Snow will likely be fluffy and windy conditions will reduce visibility and create snow drifts. There is some uncertainty with the timing of diminishing winds, but conditions will improve as winds diminish through the Wednesday morning hours.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
